meanings.definition: The loss or giving up of something as a penalty for wrongdoing.
meanings.sent1: The forfeiture of his favorite toy left him feeling sad.
meanings.sent2: The judge ordered the forfeiture of the stolen money.
meanings.sent3: After forgetting to do his chores, his forfeiture was having to skip dessert.
meanings.sent4: The forfeiture of her dreams crushed her spirit.
meanings.sent5: The forfeiture of his freedom weighed heavily on his conscience.

meanings.definition: The act of forfeiting or surrendering something.
meanings.sent1: She accepted the forfeiture of her turn in the game.
meanings.sent2: The team's forfeiture of the match disappointed their fans.
meanings.sent3: His forfeiture of the last cookie made his sister laugh.
meanings.sent4: The forfeiture of his seat on the bus was a small price to pay for kindness.
meanings.sent5: The forfeiture of his pride was necessary for reconciliation.
